alert.note: Alert for Madison; Marion; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 8:57AM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana including the following counties, Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Morgan, Shelby, Owen and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms overnight into this morning. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Low lying roads near river and streams will see flooding continue and be slow to recede after the rain has ended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indianapolis, Anderson, Carmel, Fishers, Noblesville, Greenwood, Lawrence, Plainfield, Franklin, Brownsburg, Greenfield, Lebanon, Beech Grove, Zionsville, Martinsville, Speedway, Greencastle, Mooresville, Danville and Southport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
